name: Swallow The Moon
description:
Synopsis.

The kingdom of Soleilar's filled with scholars, magicians, and people on the good side of life.

They have never known hardships—they have never known discomfort. In all their years of living, they have not one complaint.

But below Soleilar, where the criminals and murders dwell, is where you hail. Neomair. Without a ruler and no just order, you grew up discarded and unwanted. 

However, when you come of age, your magical potential is too great for even Soleilar to ignore, and you are ushered to a great college only to meet with worse adversity.

But is that really you? No.

—

In your reality, modern-day New York, the novel Swallow The Moon has taken the world by storm. Copies fly off shelves, and as you struggle to free yourself from student debt by working yourself to the bone, any entertainment is welcome. And it certainly helps that your best friend wrote the very book, right? 

You've known Saoirse Williams since preschool: you would recognize her writing anywhere. Not only did you assist her with the concept, but she also dedicated the book to you. All that's left is for you to read it and weep.

The only issue is, she's suffering from intense writer's block, so your reading of the book is more obligation than desire. So one night, suffering from a horrible headache and exhaustion, you fall asleep right over Saoirse's precious pages and wake in a place that is definitely not New York anymore.

You've become the antagonist of the YA Romance novel Swallow The Moon, but not really. The world is unlike what you read—it's changed. 

You never finished the novel, so how can you end it?

Features.

  • Customize the MC: appearance, personality, sexuality.
  • Attempt to keep the story on track or make it your own.
  • Develop your magical skills.
  • Avoid the ire of the other characters—your life depends on it.
  • Discover your purpose.
  • Romance—one of several love interests.

Romance Options.

Emile. [He/Him.] Emile is the prince of Soleilar and the main love interest in Swallow The Moon. He seems to have no opinion of you yet, but you sense a vile emotion each time he looks in your direction. He is possessive, burning, and wanting. He is cruel, and his love might be just as. But don't you want to find out? Neera/Nero. [He/Him, She/Her. Gender Selectable.] The sibling of the protagonist. They're brash and seem to harbor a burning hatred for you. However, they're fiercely protective of their sister, the protagonist. They would protect you too. Dien/Diem. [He/Him, She/Her. Gender Selectable.] D is a person vying for the protagonist's affection. D is rejected in the original story and ends up on the antagonist's side—Or your side. That has yet to happen. They're stoic and blunt—yet easily flustered. They may be cold, but their hands are warm and desperate.  Micah. [They/Them.] A strange student that looks at you like they know something you don't. You don't remember them from what you read in the book, but that doesn't stop them from tailing you nearly all the time. They are suggestive, flirty, and handful. You can't help but wonder what they want from you.

Find their appearances here.
